basic.description: This course provides students with a comprehensive overview of the natural processes associated with water occurrence and resources. Focus is given to water's unique properties, how it occurs and moves through Earth's environment; how it impacts human habitation, and its future as a critical and valuable natural resource. Development of socio-economic concepts of management, supply, use, reclamation, and sustainability are also emphasized.
basic.subject: GEO
basic.title: Geography of Water Resources
